item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: SQD provides permissionless access to petabytes of onchain data and is THE data lake for onchain AI agents.
Integrate your rollup with @helloSQD on Conduit Marketplace and let devs do more with your data.
item.dc:creator: @conduitxyz
item.description:

Integrate your rollup with @helloSQD on Conduit Marketplace and let devs do more with your data.

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: ğŸ”ˆAnnounce ğŸš€ZK Security FrameworkğŸš€
ZKPs are revolutionizing privacy and security, but they also introduce new attack surfaces. To address these challenges, @salus_sec & @zerobasezk have launched the ZK Security Frameworkâ€”a structured approach to analyzing ZKP vulnerabilities, providing security audit checklists, and offering mitigation strategies to help developers build more secure ZK systems.
ğŸ” Key Security Risks âœ… Completeness Issues: Over-constrained circuits may cause verification failures âœ… Soundness Issues: Under-constrained circuits can allow attackers to forge proofs âœ… Information Leakage: Trusted setup leaks may lead to stolen assets âœ… Arithmetic Overflows: Improper field arithmetic can be exploited
ğŸ“Š ZK Risk Classification ğŸ”´ High Risk: Proof forgery (e.g., Frozen Heart attack) ğŸŸ¡ Medium Risk: Unintended exposure of private inputs ğŸ”µ Low Risk: Interfaces that are prone to misuse âš« Informational: Redundant constraints in logical
Operations More than just an audit checklist, the ZK Security Framework serves as an essential learning resource for developers and security researchers. A huge thank you to the @ethereum & @EF_ESP team for their invaluable support! ğŸ™ŒWithout you, we wouldn't be able to complete it !
Explore now ğŸ‘‰ GitHub: https://github.com/Salusec/zksecurity-framework/
item.dc:creator: @mirrorzk
item.description:
ğŸ”ˆAnnounce ğŸš€ZK Security FrameworkğŸš€

ZKPs are revolutionizing privacy and security, but they also introduce new attack surfaces. To address these challenges, @salus_sec & @zerobasezk have launched the ZK Security Frameworkâ€”a structured approach to analyzing ZKP vulnerabilities, providing security audit checklists, and offering mitigation strategies to help developers build more secure ZK systems.

ğŸ” Key Security Risks
âœ… Completeness Issues: Over-constrained circuits may cause verification failures
âœ… Soundness Issues: Under-constrained circuits can allow attackers to forge proofs
âœ… Information Leakage: Trusted setup leaks may lead to stolen assets
âœ… Arithmetic Overflows: Improper field arithmetic can be exploited

ğŸ“Š ZK Risk Classification
ğŸ”´ High Risk: Proof forgery (e.g., Frozen Heart attack) ğŸŸ¡ Medium Risk: Unintended exposure of private inputs
ğŸ”µ Low Risk: Interfaces that are prone to misuse
âš« Informational: Redundant constraints in logical

Operations
More than just an audit checklist, the ZK Security Framework serves as an essential learning resource for developers and security researchers.
A huge thank you to the @ethereum & @EF_ESP team for their invaluable support! ğŸ™ŒWithout you, we wouldn't be able to complete it !

Explore now ğŸ‘‰ GitHub: github.com/Salusec/zksecuritâ€¦

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: Introducing zkFOCIL, a protocol for private Ethereum inclusion lists! Based on FOCIL (EIP-7805) and powered by Linkable Ring Signatures, validators publish inclusion lists privately without revealing their identity.
by @asn_d6, Benedikt and @soispoke
https://ethresear.ch/t/zkfocil-inclusion-list-privacy-using-linkable-ring-signatures/21688/1
item.dc:creator: @asn_d6

by @asn_d6, Benedikt and @soispoke
